
	E: y^2 = x^3 - 3x + b (mod p)

	#E(F_p) = p + 1 - t
	#E(F_p^2) = (p + 1 - t)*(p + 1 + t)

b = 680616598254368294015858653468400032278688648245162921457481212988487838266121706017410197802303768179517423581649948460652150151762287285211627769549950
p  = 11711338024714009669995700965425239711927177698599625717955894184681899877662827977441218356846207573509472307873756662300754437232398452830779100780970303
nE = 11711338024714009669995700965425239711927177698599625717955894184681899877662611539569996945969293708404400344208273812850399351303651875378098503534075638
t = 216437871221410876913865105071963665482849450355085928746577452680597246894666

# log(p, 2) == 512
# p = 3 (mod 4)

n = 2^159 + 2^17 + 1
# r | (p + 1)

# this is a non-supersingular curve because something is wrong.
